personalInfo.name: Fabian Buentello
personalInfo.title: Software Developer
personalInfo.personalText: Ambitious developer passionate about creating Mobile and Web experiences for users. I enjoy working on projects that challenge me not only as a developer, but as a person as well. I find no pleasure in developing new technology using old languages. I am constantly pushing myself to learn new techniques to better myself as a developer.

skills.title: Mobile
skills.text: Developing for both iOS and Android is by far the most exciting type of development for me. I have developed from a fully native social networking app to communicating via Bluetooth between mobile devices and micro-controllers.

skills.title: Programming
skills.text: Have a strong fundamental understanding of languages such as Java, C, and C++. Have used these languages to build native applications for Mac and PC. Along with using C++ to program mBed micro-controllers.

skills.title: Hardware
skills.text: Experience with micro-controllers from manufactures like Arduino, BeagleBone, Raspberry Pi, mBed, and Texas Instruments. Experiments include using relays to control components such as servos, motors, and solenoids.

skills.title: Front End
skills.text: From HTML,CSS, and JS to more advance frameworks such as Angular.js and LESS. I am constantly learning new ways to implement old methods. I look forward to what new challenges web development brings me.

skills.title: Back End
skills.text: With early experiences with scripting languages such as PHP to now deploying a server in a matter of minutes with Node.js or Ruby on Rails. Developing scalable backends with robust API's is one of my main passion.

skills.title: Database
skills.text: Currently am using NoSQL databases similar to MongoDB since they go hand in hand with Node.js. I do have a strong understanding of SQL databases from my experience developing a social networking application.

languages.name: Javascript(Frontend/Backend)
languages.text:
Back end

Go to Frameworks
  • NodeJS
  • SailsJS

With excitment surrounding io.js, I'm excited for Node's future. ps: I can build one mean MEAN Stack app ;).

Front end

Go to Frameworks
  • AngularJS
  • EmberJS
  • The emphamis ElevatorJS :P

With new frameworks coming out every 7th minute of every hour. It's not so much about what Javascript frameworks you know, but how fast can you adopt a new one.

languages.name: Objective-C/Swift
languages.text:
[[Speak Brackets] toMe];

Go to Frameworks
  • Mantle
  • ReactiveCocoa

first and foremost, Objective-C is my first passion. I learned it before I learned any other programming language. I had no idea it was one of the more difficult languages to learn. I use this as motivation when I come across obstacles. Now with swift making its way in, programming for Apple devices has never been easier.

languages.name: Android
languages.text:
Confessions of a Java Head

Been doing Android for about 2 years. Have built prototype POS system for dry cleaners to a mobile Injector for the Node-RED Project. I would be lying if I said I do enough Android projects, just being honest. Feel free to drop a few project suggestions :)

languages.name: HTML/CSS
languages.text:
LESS SASS please!

Styling

Yes Bootstrap made working with CSS a whole lot easier. But using frameworks such as LESS and SASS makes working with CSS downright simple.

<!--[if lt IE 9]> Design me a website please <![endif]-->

Building a website from the ground up just doesn't sound as appealing as it used to be. I enjoy using scaffolding tools such as Yeoman and task automators like Grunt to help make my life easier.
